meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Hints of a Slower Economy Evidence of slower economic growth is budding in some industries, but some Federal Reserve officials are not concluding that the overall economy is slowing.
Hints of a Slower Economy Evidence of slower economic growth is budding in some industries, but some Federal Reserve officials are not concluding that the overall economy is slowing.

Russian Media Baron Held Vladimir Gusinsky, the media tycoon who controls Russia's only independent television network, was arrested on embezzlement charges, prompting protests that this was an attack on press freedom.
Lockheed Fined $13 Million Lockheed Martin, the world's largest military contractor, was given a record fine by the State Department for giving satellite information to China, officials said.
Runway Risks on the Rise The risk of runway collisions is growing with increased air traffic, and a long-delayed computer system will not solve the problem, federal safety officials say.
Switch by Chilean Military In an acknowledgment of its responsibility, the Chilean military agreed to search for the remains of 1,200 dissidents who disappeared during the Pinochet dictatorship.
Elevator Music? No, Video Riding the office elevator may become less tedious with the addition of silent, flat-panel video screens that show advertising and news via the Internet.
Midwest Gas Prices Soar Gasoline prices in the Midwest have risen sharply, and the government says it does not know why.
